data.event: Washington County was established in 1792 from land given by Nelson County.
The Washington County Courthouse, completed in 1816, is the oldest courthouse still in use in Kentucky.
The bond is dated June 10, 1806; it was written the day before the marriage in the small community of Beechland on the Little Beech River.
The marriage return was signed by Jesse Head, the Methodist preacher who performed the ceremony, and dates the marriage to June 12, 1806.
